description.narrative:
Det föreslagna stödet till "Strategic Note of UN Women South Sudan 2014-2016" är en fortsättning på till tidigare Sida finansierat "Un Women Strategic Note Capacity Building for Gender Equality and Women´s Economic Empowerment in Soutn Sudan 2012-2013" (fölängt till 30 juni 2015). UN Women strateic note fokuserar på fyra nyckelområden; 1) Kvinnors ledarskap och deltagande 2) Kvinnors Ekonomiska Egenmakt 3) Könsbaserat våld 4) Kvinnors deltagande i fred och säkerhet och humanitära insatser. Förväntade resultat av programmet är 1) Kvinnor leder och deltar i beslutsfattande på alla nivåer 2) Kvinnor, särskilt de mest utsatta och exkluderade, är ekonomiskt stärkta och drar nytta av utvecklingen 3) Kvinnor och flickor lever ett liv fritt från våld 4) Fred och säkerhet och humanitära insatser i Sydsudan formas av kvinnligt ledarskap och deltagande.
Den föreslagna insatsen ligger i linje med ett av de två förväntade resultaten i Sveriges resultatstrategi för Sydsudan 2014-2016 som är ”stärkt förmåga hos civilsamhället att verka för ökad respekt för de mänskliga rättigheterna samt försoning mellan rivaliserande folkgrupper och därigenom bidra till stärkt demokrati.” Programmets mål är också förenligt med Sveriges humanitära strategi. UN Women South Sudan Strategic Plan 2014-2016, till vilken Sida givit stöd till under föregående fas, syftar till att öka jämställdheten och kvinnors sociala, ekonomiska och politiska egenmakt. Målet ska ta sitt uttryck i att 1) Kvinnor leder och deltar i beslutsfattande på nationell och subnationell nivå, 2) Kvinnor, framförallt de fattigaste och mest exkluderade, har en starkare ekonomisk makt och får ta del av utvecklingen, 3) Kvinnor och flickor lever ett liv fritt från våld, samt 4) Kvinnor leder och deltar i Sydsudans fred och säkerhet samt humanitära insatser.
UN Women´s program har visat goda resultat under den senaste avtalsperioden (2011-2013, förlängt till 30 juni 2015, totalt belopp 34,9 MSEK) trots den civila konflikt som Sydsudan upplevt som resulterat i över 1,6 miljoner flyktingar (varav en miljon internflyktingar). Programmet har bl a lett till att Sydsudan ratificerat Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women (CEDAW) och antagit en nationell plan för genomförandet av FN:s säkerhetsrådsresolution 1325. UN Women´s totala budget är ca 80 MSEK, varav Sidas stöd utgör 44%.
Sida har valt att allokera ett större belopp till UN Women Sydsudan under 2015 än vad som är planerat för 2016. Återbetalningar från insatser till Sydsudan anslaget har gjort att det finansiella utrymmet är större 2015 än 2016.

The proposed support to the Strategic Note of UN Women South Sudan 2014-2016 is a continuation of the Sida contribution to the previous UN Women Strategic Note “Capacity Building for Gender Equality and Women's Empowerment in South Sudan” 2012-2013 (extended to 30 June 2015). The UN Women Strategic Note (2014-2016) focuses on four key areas; 1) Women’s Leadership and Participation, 2) Women’s Economic Empowerment, 2) Violence against Women and Girls and 4) Women’s engagement in Peace and Security and Humanitarian Action. The expected results of the programme are: 1) Women lead and participate in decision making at all levels, 2) Women, especially the poorest and most excluded, are economically empowered and benefit from development, 3) Women and girls live a life free from violence and 4) Peace and security and humanitarian actions in South Sudan are shaped by women´s leadership and participation.The intervention´s total budget is approxamatly 80 MSEK, of which Sida´s contribution is 44%.
Women´s social, economic and political empowerment in South Sudan enhanced.

tag.narrative: 5.c - Adopt and strengthen sound policies and enforceable legislation for the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls at all levels.
5.c - Anta och stärka välgrundad politik och genomförbar lagstiftning för att främja jämställdhet och öka alla kvinnors och flickors egenmakt på alla nivåer

description.narrative: This Completion Memo (2016-2018) replaces the Conclusion of Performance 2018. The context in South Sudan has been challenging during the period (2016-2018) and this has impacted UN Women's country program. The changing political context had major consequences on the social and economic environment. Therefore the UN Women's strategic plan (2015-2018 Strategic Note) was changed several times to accommodate key events such as the outbreak of civil war and massive displacements of the population, optimism around the Peace Agreement signed in 2015 and thereafter the pessimism after new outbreaks of conflict in July 2016. All this needs to be taken into account when analysing the achievement of results. The analysis concludes that there are mainly three areas that have been more successful than others: * Peacebuilding and recovery * Women's economic empowerment * Strengthening of UN Women Country Office One major achievement that UN Women has contributed to through their partners is increased participation of women in the peace negotiations in Addis Abeba and Khartoum in 2018. This resulted in strengthened affirmative action principle from 25% to 35% in the revitalized peace agreement (R-ARCSS), which means that women have the right to require 35% of the places in decision making organs on national, regional and local level. UN Women facilitated the establishment of the National Training Leadership Institute (NTLI) that provides training in transformational leadership, peacebuilding and economic empowerment skills. So far the institute has trained more than 1000 women and young female leaders. A database for women leaders' profiles has been developed containing information on professional qualifications and skills. One intention of this database is to be able to uphold the gender provision of R-ARCSS, but also to concretely be able to have names on qualified women that can candidate for positions for example in future election so that the 35% quota can be upheld. Another achievement is the establishment of over 60 village saving and loans schemes. These schemes have mobilized approximately 88 190 USD and have resulted in the establishment of 1000 new businesses. The women's savings and assets building has not only led to increased household income but also empowered women, ability to make long term decisions about their families' future incl. resurces to send their children to school and less spouse quarrels and other forms of abuse which can be attributed to economic empowerment. UN Women is a relative new organisation within the UN family and has had its difficulties in establishing a well functioning promoter of gender equality and women's empowerment. Sida provides core support to the UN Women country office and its activities. During 2016-2018, the country office has strengthened its capacity including recruiting additional staff with more specified expertise. The office has also develop new staffing structure to better deliver on the Strategic Note. In 2018 an external Country Portfolio Evaluation concluded that the Country Office has motivated staff with capacity to deliver efficiently across its three mandates. Please find also some more examples of results where UN Women has been instrumental for its achievements: - The Maputo protocol was raified after advocacy by Women Parliamentary Caucus (UN Women supported the WPC). - The development of a National Gender Policy and the National Action Plan on 1325. - A National Action Plan on ending SGBV and Action Plan on Conflict related Sexual Violence were developed. - South Sudan developed the interim national report to the CEDAW committee. - 120 traditional leaders and chiefs developed strategies for mainstreaming gender and women's rights into the practices in their communities. - Labour burden of women targeted reduced by over 2 hours on the daily average of their time for crop production through gaining access to high value vegetable and technologies. -The Women Enterprise Fund has been established. This fund will provide subsidized credits for women-based entreprise development and capacity building of women entrepreneurs. - 53% of leadership positions in both IDP camps and in the host communities in Mingkaman were held by women 2018. - UN Women continues to lead the gender coordination of different cluster/working groups in South Sudan such as; Cluster on Women and Youth, UN Gender Technical Working Group, Humanitarian Cluster Gender Focal Group and the Coordination mechanism for accountability to gender equality.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
